title: Enacts the "North Star Initiative"
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3892

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 28, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. FINCH -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Economic Development

       AN ACT to amend the economic development law, in  relation  to  enacting
         the "North Star Initiative"

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. This act shall be known and may be cited as the "North Star
    2  Initiative".
    3    S 2. The economic development law is amended by adding a  new  article
    4  18 to read as follows:
    5                                 ARTICLE 18
    6                          THE NORTH STAR INITIATIVE
    7  SECTION 380. FACILITIES CLOSURE PROCESS.
    8          381. THE NORTH STAR INITIATIVE COMMISSION.
    9    S  380.  FACILITIES  CLOSURE PROCESS. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF
   10  LAW TO THE CONTRARY, NO STATE-OWNED AND STATE-RUN FACILITY THAT IS SCHE-
   11  DULED TO BE CLOSED SHALL CLOSE WITHIN TWO  YEARS  OF  THE  DATE  OF  THE
   12  NOTIFICATION  OF  CLOSURE. UPON NOTIFICATION, THE PROPOSED CLOSURE SHALL
   13  BE REFERRED TO THE  NORTH  STAR  INITIATIVE  COMMISSION  ESTABLISHED  BY
   14  SECTION  THREE  HUNDRED  EIGHTY-ONE  OF  THIS  ARTICLE  FOR STUDY OF THE
   15  EFFECTS OF THE CLOSURE AND DEVELOPMENT OF A PLAN TO MITIGATE THE ECONOM-
   16  IC IMPACT OF THE CLOSURE ON THE AFFECTED LOCAL AREA. IN NO EVENT SHALL A
   17  FACILITY BE CLOSED WITHIN TWO YEARS AFTER NOTIFICATION OF THE CLOSURE.
   18    S 381. THE NORTH STAR INITIATIVE COMMISSION. 1. A STATE COMMISSION, TO
   19  BE KNOWN AS THE NORTH STAR INITIATIVE COMMISSION,  HEREINAFTER  REFERRED
   20  TO  AS THE COMMISSION, IS HEREBY CREATED TO EXAMINE, EVALUATE AND DETER-
   21  MINE THE APPROPRIATE HANDLING OF THE CLOSING  OF  STATE  OWNED  AND  RUN
   22  FACILITIES  AND TO DEVELOP A PLAN TO MITIGATE THE ECONOMIC IMPACT OF THE
   23  CLOSURE ON THE AFFECTED LOCAL AREA AS PROVIDED IN SECTION THREE  HUNDRED
   24  EIGHTY OF THIS ARTICLE.
   25    2. THE COMMISSION SHALL CONSIST OF MEMBERS AS FOLLOWS:

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03794-01-1

       A. 3892                             2

    1    (A) THE CHAIR OF THE EMPIRE STATE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION;
    2    (B)  THE  CHIEF  EXECUTIVE  OFFICER  OF  EACH MUNICIPALITY AFFECTED BY
    3  CLOSURES;
    4    (C) THE DIRECTOR OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT  AGENCY  OF  EACH  REGION
    5  AFFECTED; AND
    6    (D)  REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE FINANCIAL, EDUCATION AND BUSINESS COMMU-
    7  NITY.
    8    3. PRIOR TO THE CLOSURE OF A  STATE  FACILITY,  THE  COMMISSION  SHALL
    9  DEVELOP  A PLAN TO ADDRESS THE ECONOMIC AND QUALITY OF LIFE NEEDS OF THE
   10  COMMUNITIES AFFECTED BY THE CLOSURE OF  STATE  FACILITIES,  INCLUDING  A
   11  COMPONENT  FOR  REPLACING  LOST  REVENUE  THAT SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTS THE
   12  AFFECTED COMMUNITY OR COMMUNITIES, AND A VIABLE REUSE  OF  THE  BUILDING
   13  HOUSING  THE  FACILITY  TO  BE CLOSED IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT ANY ENTITY
   14  CLOSINGS DESIGNED TO SAVE TAXPAYER MONEY WOULD  ALLOW  THE  LOCALITY  TO
   15  REUSE  THE  FORMER  SITE IN A WAY THAT PROVIDES INCOME FOR THE COMMUNITY
   16  AND GIVE THE AFFECTED PERSONNEL TIME TO MAKE ARRANGEMENTS FOR A TRANSFER
   17  TO ANOTHER FACILITY OR FIND ALTERNATIVE  EMPLOYMENT  IN  THE  AREA.  THE
   18  COMMISSION  SHALL  CREATE  A  VIABLE  REUSE PLAN TAILORED TO AN AFFECTED
   19  LOCAL COMMUNITY'S SPECIFIC NEEDS TO MAKE UP FOR THE  DEVASTATING  IMPACT
   20  OF FACILITY CLOSURES ON LOCAL ECONOMIES.
   21    4.  THE  MEMBERS  OF  THE COMMISSION SHALL RECEIVE NO COMPENSATION FOR
   22  THEIR SERVICES, BUT SHALL BE ALLOWED THEIR ACTUAL AND NECESSARY EXPENSES
   23  INCURRED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THEIR DUTIES HEREUNDER.  TO  THE  MAXIMUM
   24  EXTENT FEASIBLE, THE COMMISSION SHALL BE ENTITLED TO REQUEST AND RECEIVE
   25  AND  SHALL  UTILIZE AND BE PROVIDED WITH SUCH FACILITIES, RESOURCES, AND
   26  DATA OF ANY COURT, DEPARTMENT, DIVISION, BOARD, BUREAU,  COMMISSION,  OR
   27  AGENCY  OF  THE  STATE  OR ANY POLITICAL SUBDIVISION THEREOF AS IT DEEMS
   28  NECESSARY OR DESIRABLE TO CARRY OUT PROPERLY ITS POWERS AND DUTIES HERE-
   29  UNDER.
   30    5. THE COMMISSION SHALL RECEIVE A BUDGET  DESIGNATED  IN  THE  DEPART-
   31  MENT'S BUDGET WHICH SHALL BE USED FOR FUNDING OF THE COMMISSION EXPENSES
   32  AND INITIATIVES.
   33    6.  THE COMMISSION MAY EMPLOY AND AT PLEASURE REMOVE SUCH PERSONNEL AS
   34  IT MAY DEEM NECESSARY FOR THE PERFORMANCE OF ITS FUNCTIONS AND FIX THEIR
   35  COMPENSATION WITHIN THE AMOUNTS MADE AVAILABLE THEREFOR.
   36    7. THE COMMISSION SHALL MEET WITHIN THE STATE, SHALL HOLD PUBLIC HEAR-
   37  INGS, AND SHALL HAVE ALL THE POWERS OF A LEGISLATIVE COMMITTEE  PURSUANT
   38  TO THE LEGISLATIVE LAW.
   39    8.  THE  COMMISSION  SHALL SUBMIT ITS FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR
   40  THE GOVERNANCE OF THE CANAL CORPORATION IN A REPORT TO THE GOVERNOR, THE
   41  TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, AND THE SPEAKER OF  THE  ASSEMBLY  NO
   42  LATER THAN ONE YEAR AFTER IT FIRST CONVENES.
   43    S 3. Subdivision 47 of section 100 of the economic development law, as
   44  renumbered by chapter 427 of the laws of 2008, is renumbered subdivision
   45  48 and a new subdivision 47 is added to read as follows:
   46    47. TO DEVELOP, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF THE DEPARTMENT
   47  OF  TAXATION AND FINANCE, A PROPOSAL TO BE SUBMITTED TO THE GOVERNOR AND
   48  THE LEGISLATURE,  AND  RECOMMENDATIONS  FOR  LEGISLATION  REGARDING  THE
   49  IMPLEMENTATION  OF VARIOUS TAX INCENTIVES AND TAX EXEMPTIONS FOR CAPITAL
   50  GAINS FOR INVESTMENT IN VACANT FACILITIES CLOSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH  THE
   51  PROVISIONS OF ARTICLE EIGHTEEN OF THIS CHAPTER.
   52    S 4. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   53  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   54  ly,  the  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation
   55  necessary for the implementation of this act on its effective  date  are
   56  authorized and directed to be made and completed on or before such date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the economic development law, in relation to enacting the "North Star Initiative"
